It is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that are often pale or translucent, giving it a ghostly appearance. These plants are native to Australia and are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. Hemiphora species are herbaceous perennials that often have hairy stems and leaves. They are known for their ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making them an interesting subject for botanical study.
